creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: image of a hand, rendered in thin black lines, and is white in color, with abstract spirals on index and ring finger; multicolored geometric shapes surround hand; blue and black shaded background, with thin white lines protruding out of shapes; white mat board with white frame
inscription: Signed and dated lower right corner: \'84/Paulina Peavy
markings: LLC, verso: gallery label from Andrew Edlin Gallery, New York, NY
signed: LRC, in black ink: Paulina Peavy \'84
text: Paulina Peavy was a formally-trained artist who worked professionally and made spiritually-based organic figural work. After attending a séance in the 1930s she claimed that she was contacted by an entity calling itself Lacamo and from then on she and Lacamo were artistic collaborators. She made art channeling Lacamo and the two of them signed the work. Peavy made “trance masks” in order to better tune in Lacamo’s vibrational communications.
title: Untitled
